title: Trips and pictures
author: Name
description: This page is off-topic and just for fun. It has links to diaries of trips and to picture albums. A break in the Shetland Isles (album) Trip to McGill, Yale, Columbia and Stony Brook and picture alb...

[#efficiencysavings](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23efficiencysavings&src=hash) [#weaselwords](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23weaselwords&src=hash) [pic.twitter.com/muYCcCPCZL](https://pic.twitter.com/muYCcCPCZL) [@CaulfieldTim](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim)sure! But it's 1 am. here -good night [@CaulfieldTim](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim)sounds good. But the problems mostly lie with academics. Self-inflicted wounds [@CaulfieldTim](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim)Trudeau looks great. Can we have him please? [@CaulfieldTim](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim)Here is an early example [www.dcscience.net/2007/12/05/w...](http://www.dcscience.net/2007/12/05/why-honey-isnt-a-wonder-cure/)and recent ones [www.dcscience.net/2014/11/02/t...](http://www.dcscience.net/2014/11/02/two-more-cases-of-hype-in-glamour-journals-magnets-cocoa-and-memory/) RT [@taslimanasreen](https://twitter.com/taslimanasreen): Had meeting with Elmar Brok, Chair of the Committee on Foreign Affairs at the European Parliament today. [pic.twitter.com/sb9lYfqKD6](https://pic.twitter.com/sb9lYfqKD6) RT [@taslimanasreen](https://twitter.com/taslimanasreen): I spoke at the European Parliament today about how freethinkers getting killed,& govt remains silent in Bangladesh. [pic.twitter.com/rW0XW5KBw9](https://pic.twitter.com/rW0XW5KBw9) [@CaulfieldTim](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim)no, it isn't fair to blame reporting. They hypsecomes from jml and university PR people, endorsed by authors Exactly. Bur publishers make cash publishing junk, and senior academics push you to publish every 10 min. Disaster [twitter.com/CaulfieldTim/statu...](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim/status/723660791526883328) [@CaulfieldTim](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim)harms science because every time the latest diet/exercise advice appears in the media, people just jeer (often rightly) [@CaulfieldTim](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim)do you think there's a case for stopping obs epidemiology? It so often gives wrong answer, harms people & harms science How does such dubious junk science get published. I often wonder [twitter.com/CaulfieldTim/statu...](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim/status/723658356607586304) If there was ever a case for reverse causality, that's it [twitter.com/CaulfieldTim/statu...](https://twitter.com/CaulfieldTim/status/723658356607586304) Trips and pictures This page is off-topic and just for fun.
